title: Dub spots
name: Dub spots
description:
A Map by Garlynn

Puttin' vinyl on the map:

* Records stores that sell vinyl
* *especially* record stores that allow you to listen first!!

properties.name: 2nd Avenue Records
properties.description: Posted by Bobbylilly400 SW 2ND Ave portland, orOne of the best record stores in town

properties.name: 360 Vinyl
properties.description: Posted by Bobbylilly214 NW Couch St portland, orNew and used records

properties.name: Amoeba Music - San Francisco, CA USA
properties.description: Posted by Namwith  1855 Haight Street, San Francisco, CA, 94117Amoeba Music 415-831-1200

properties.name: Anthem Records
properties.description: Posted by Brian828 SE 34TH AVE. SUITE C, portland, orHas all the stuff I am looking for and John always has great recommendations.

properties.name: Aquarius Records SF
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1055 Valencia Street, San Francisco, California 94110Since 1970. SF\'s oldest independent record store. Small, though. you don\'t go here looking for a record you want. More to peruse the records that they sell.

properties.name: BPM Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn654 Fillmore, san francisco, caThis place has been around since 1991, though they\'ve recently moved up the hill from their old location on Hayes St, and may still be in the transition process. Lots of house music and some breaks and other electronica, with a little bit of reggae and other stuff thrown in for good measure.

properties.name: Brickwall Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn704 NE Dekum St, Portland, OR

properties.name: Crossroads Music
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 3130 SE Hawthorne Blvd # B, Portland, ORCrossroads features an eclectic mix if vintage vinyl from multiple sellers.

properties.name: Everyday Music - Downtown, Jazz & Classical
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion  1313 West Burnside Street, Portland, OR, 97209Everyday Music - Downtown, Jazz & Classical

properties.name: Everyday Music: Eastside
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 1931 NE Sandy Blvd, Portland, OR

properties.name: Fabulous Jackpot Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn203 SW 9th Ave, Portland, OR

properties.name: Force of Habit Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 3565 20th St, San Francisco, CAum, a punk record store?

properties.name: Groove Merchant Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn687 Haight St, San Francisco, CAThey\'ve got a listening station and they\'re tiny!!

properties.name: Housewares
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1322 Haight Street, sf, caUnverified listing -- heard of this place, haven\'t visited. They may or may not sell records. They probably don\'t let you listne to them. Let me know if you visit, or I\'ll update once I do.

properties.name: InHouse Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynnmission st & 6th st, san francisco, caJust a bit down Mission Street from 6th Street, upstairs on the second floor of a building in a run-down section of town, is InHouse Records. Featuring five listening stations and a whole lotta house music on vinyl. No CDs or tapes to speak of, but these guys do seem to know their stuff. Lots of white labels, too.

properties.name: Jackpot Records
properties.description: Posted by Ericwmast3736 Se Hawthorne Blvd, Portland, OR

properties.name: Jump Jump Music
properties.description: Posted by System  7005 Northeast Prescott Street, Portland, OR, 97218Jump Jump Music 503-284-4828

properties.name: Mississippi Records
properties.description: Posted by System 4007 North Mississippi Avenue, Portland, OR, 97227Mississippi Records 503-282-2990

properties.name: Music Millenium NW
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 801 NW 23rd Ave, Portland, OR

properties.name: One Love Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn8714 N Lombard St, Portland, OR

properties.name: Open Mind Music
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 342 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CAThey\'e got two or three listening stations, and a fairly decent selection of music from many genres. Good soul & jazz selection.

properties.name: Ozone Records
properties.description: Posted by Ericwmast701 E Burnside, Portland, OR 97232

properties.name: Ozone Records UK
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn2 NW 10th Ave, Portland, OR

properties.name: Recycled Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1377 Haight St, San Francisco, CAYet another used record store in the Haight. Dunno about listening stations.

properties.name: Reverb Music
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 3623 SE Hawthorne Blvd, Portland, OR

properties.name: Soundworks
properties.description: Posted by System 228 Valencia Street, San Francisco, CA, 94103Soundworks 415415-487487-39801972

properties.name: Streetlight Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn3979 24th St, San Francisco, CAThey don\'t let you listen, but they\'ve got a selection.

properties.name: Tweekin Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn593 Haight St, San Francisco, CAOne of San Francisco\'s best DJ-oriented record stores. Features five vinyl (& 1 CD) listening stations, in addition to a vast array of house music, plus some dub, reggae and others thrown in for variety. The owners are all respected SF house music DJs, as well. Tell them you found them on Garlynn\'s map. :-)

properties.name: Vinyl Resting Place
properties.description: Posted by Bobbylilly8332 N Lombard St portland, orUsed records

properties.name: Wisdom Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn4308 Mission St, San Francisco, CAWisdom Records -- THE source for reggae, dub, and dancehall. That\'s all they do. And they do it well. Run by rastas, with a single listening station, way the f* out on Mission Street, almost to Daly City... well, actually, not quite that far out, which always throws me as I overshoot it when I\'m trying to find it. Look hard. It\'s upstairs, you have to ring the buzzer to get buzzed in, and the sign is SMALL. Lots of 7" as well as 12".

properties.name: Zen City Records
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn105 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA"Dance Music": Some house, some of that other stuff... and listening stations, so you can tell what it sounds like. Crucial, that last bit.
